SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am40
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am40.server.model

Class PrivateBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am40.server.model.PrivateBoard
public class PrivateBoard extends Object
The PrivateBoard class represents the place where a Player keeps all the cards and contains, also, all the data related the game logic. The cards possessed by a Player are in the handDeck and the cards placed are in the cardGrid. A Player can play a card in one of the position contained in the placingCoordinates. In the case of placing a goldCard or checking an aimCard, the elementsCounter eases the checking operation.

    • addCardToHand

      public void addCardToHand(ResourceCard card)
      This method takes the Card drawn in the draw phase and adds it to the Player's private handDeck
      Parameters:
      card - is the card that a player chose to pick from the CommonBoard

    • takeCardFromHand

      public ResourceCard takeCardFromHand(int choice)
      This method serves as a mean to choose a Card from the handDeck and then, by giving the input choice, returns the Card that will be placed with the corresponding method
      Parameters:
      choice - is the index of the card chosen by a Player
      Returns:
      the card chosen as a ResourceCard Note: in case of an illegal choice index, the first card will always be returned

    • checkPlacing

      public boolean checkPlacing(ResourceCard card, Coordinates coordinates, CardFace cardFace)
      This method checks if a card can be placed on a player's cardGrid in his PrivateBoard after a Player choose: a card in his handDeck, the coordinates of the placement and the CardFace orientation. If a Card is a GoldResourceCard type and CardFace is set to front, it checks the requirements
      Parameters:
      card - is the card chosen by a player to be placed
      coordinates - are the coordinates chosen by a player to indicate where the card will be placed
      cardFace - is the orientation of the card chosen by a player
      Returns:
      true if a card can be placed, false otherwise

    • placing

      public void placing(ResourceCard card, Coordinates coordinates, CardFace cardFace)
      This method simulates the placing action performed by a player by adding the card chosen from the handDeck to cardGrid and setting the cardFace to the right orientation and the Coordinates position. If a Card is placed on the back, all the EdgeStates change to FREE, because till the placement phase, they represent the FRONT state. In a similar way, this change works also for the StartingCard, through dynamic association during the call of the method activationOnGrid(cardFace). It also ensures that the overlapping Edges of adjacentCards are all set to TAKEN
      Parameters:
      card - is the card chosen by a player to be placed
      coordinates - are the coordinates chosen by a player to indicate where the card will be placed
      cardFace - is the orientation of the card chosen by a player

    • refreshPoints

      public int refreshPoints()
      This method serves as a mean to inform the Player on how many points he gained by placing a Card on the cardGrid by calling the related method on every Card placed
      Returns:
      the amount of points that the last Card gives after being placed Note: if a ResourceCard is placed and has no scorePoints shown, the increase of the score will be 0 Note: if the Card is placed with CardFace == BACK it will be returned 0 as score increase

    • refreshElementsCounter

      public void refreshElementsCounter()
      This method refresh the elementsCounter attribute by removing the elements covered by the last card positioned and adding the elements present on the last card edges if CardFace is FRONT, otherwise the resource on the centre if the CardFace is BACK. In case of a StartingCard, through polymorphism this method ensures the correct addition of the element

    • refreshPlacingCoordinates

      public void refreshPlacingCoordinates()
      This method refreshes the placingCoordinates Arraylist after a Card is placed. There are two phases: the first where the Coordinates of the last added Card to the cardGrid are removed; the second phase, instead consists in adding the new Coordinates available only if the EdgesState in analysis of the last added Card is FREE. NOTE: In case of a Coordinates conflict, in other word when the Coordinates of a future placing produce the risk of a possible multiple corner overlap. In this case the Coordinates will be added only if they satisfy the rules of the game. (All adjacent EdgeStates of the card already placed are FREE)

    • elementsCounterDifferences

      public Map<CardElements,Integer> elementsCounterDifferences(Map<CardElements,Integer> tmpElementsCounter)
      This method is used in PlacingAction when it becomes necessary to fetch the changes made after a Placing
      Parameters:
      tmpElementsCounter - is a copy of this.elementsCounter before the placing
      Returns:
      a Map with the keys that suffered a value change and the new values related
